description.zh-cn: 菲律宾南部的一个由伊斯兰恐怖分子组成的摩洛人分离主义组织，以极端和危险著称，曾制造多起爆炸、袭击及绑架事件。2014年宣誓效忠伊斯兰国。
description.en: A Moro separatist organization composed of Islamic terrorists in the southern Philippines, known for being extreme and dangerous. It has carried out numerous bombings, attacks, and kidnappings. It pledged allegiance to the Islamic State in 2014.

nodes.id: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

zh-cn: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫的创始人。曾是教师，在沙特学习伊斯兰神学，于利比亚接受军事训练，并参与过阿富汗的“圣战”。
description.en: Founder of Abu Sayyaf. He was a former teacher, studied Islamic theology in Saudi Arabia, received military training in Libya, and participated in the 'jihad' in Afghanistan.

description.zh-cn: 阿布杜拉加克·简加拉尼的弟弟及继承人，阿布沙耶夫前领导人，被认为比其兄更为残酷冷血，是一名爆炸专家。
description.en: The younger brother and successor of Abdurajak Janjalani, former leader of Abu Sayyaf. Considered more cruel and cold-blooded than his brother, and was an explosives expert.

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫组织头目之一。
description.en: One of the leaders of the Abu Sayyaf group.

description.zh-cn: 东南亚国家，其政府军与阿布沙耶夫组织长期发生冲突。
description.en: A country in Southeast Asia whose government forces have been in long-term conflict with the Abu Sayyaf group.

en: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant

description.zh-cn: 一个活跃在伊拉克和叙利亚的圣战组织。阿布沙耶夫于2014年宣誓效忠该组织。
description.en: A jihadist organization active in Iraq and Syria, to which Abu Sayyaf pledged allegiance in 2014.

description.zh-cn: 1979年至1989年苏联对阿富汗的军事入侵，吸引了包括阿布杜拉加克·简加拉尼在内的外国武装分子参与所谓的“圣战”。
description.en: The military invasion of Afghanistan by the Soviet Union from 1979 to 1989, which attracted foreign militants, including Abdurajak Janjalani, to participate in the so-called 'jihad'.

description.zh-cn: 2000年4月23日，阿布沙耶夫在马来西亚西巴丹岛将21名多国游客劫持到菲律宾的事件。
description.en: An incident on April 23, 2000, where Abu Sayyaf kidnapped 21 multinational tourists from Sipadan Island, Malaysia, and took them to the Philippines.

description.zh-cn: 2017年5月23日，阿布沙耶夫与毛特组织占领菲律宾棉兰老岛马拉维地区的事件。
description.en: An event on May 23, 2017, where Abu Sayyaf and the Maute group occupied the Marawi area on Mindanao island, Philippines.

description.zh-cn: 菲律宾的一个伊斯兰恐怖组织，与阿布沙耶夫结盟并共同参与了马拉维危机。
description.en: An Islamic terrorist group in the Philippines, allied with Abu Sayyaf and jointly participated in the Battle of Marawi.

description.zh-cn: 菲律宾前总统。在2001年绑架事件后，下令对阿布沙耶夫发动大规模军事进攻。
description.en: Former President of the Philippines. Ordered a large-scale military offensive against Abu Sayyaf after the 2001 kidnapping incident.

description.zh-cn: 将阿布沙耶夫列为恐怖组织，并对其进行通缉。
description.en: Designated Abu Sayyaf as a terrorist organization and issued wanted notices for its members.

description.zh-cn: 东南亚国家，其沙巴州多次成为阿布沙耶夫绑架活动的目标。
description.en: A country in Southeast Asia whose state of Sabah has repeatedly been the target of Abu Sayyaf's kidnapping activities.

description.zh-cn: 将阿布沙耶夫列为恐怖组织的国家之一。
description.en: One of the countries that has designated Abu Sayyaf as a terrorist organization.

description.en: A Moro separatist organization in the Philippines, which is hostile to Abu Sayyaf.

description.zh-cn: 从摩洛民族解放阵线分裂出的摩洛人分离主义组织，与阿布沙耶夫为敌对关系。
description.en: A Moro separatist organization that split from the Moro National Liberation Front, and is hostile to Abu Sayyaf.

description.zh-cn: 全球性的伊斯兰恐怖组织，阿布沙耶夫曾是其盟友。
description.en: A global Islamic terrorist organization that was formerly an ally of Abu Sayyaf.

description.zh-cn: 在马来西亚沙巴州被阿布沙耶夫成员劫持并杀害的台湾游客。
description.en: A Taiwanese tourist who was kidnapped and killed by Abu Sayyaf members in Sabah, Malaysia.

description.zh-cn: 在马来西亚沙巴州被阿布沙耶夫成员劫持的台湾游客，后获释。
description.en: A Taiwanese tourist who was kidnapped by Abu Sayyaf members in Sabah, Malaysia, and later released.

description.zh-cn: 2016年9月2日，阿布沙耶夫在菲律宾达沃市一夜市制造的炸弹爆炸事件，造成多人伤亡。
description.en: A bombing incident carried out by Abu Sayyaf at a night market in Davao City, Philippines on September 2, 2016, resulting in multiple casualties.

description.en: Abdurajak Abubakar Janjalani founded the Abu Sayyaf group in 1991.

relationships.source: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 阿布杜拉加克·简加拉尼是阿布沙耶夫的创始人和首任领导人，直至1998年被击毙。
description.en: Abdurajak Janjalani was the founder and first leader of Abu Sayyaf until he was killed in 1998.

relationships.target: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 1998年12月18日，菲律宾警方向阿布沙耶夫组织发动猛攻，击毙了阿布杜拉加克。
description.en: On December 18, 1998, the Philippine police launched a fierce attack on the Abu Sayyaf organization, killing Abdurajak.

relationships.target: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 卡扎菲·简加拉尼是阿布杜拉加克·简加拉尼的亲弟弟。
description.en: Khadaffy Janjalani is the younger brother of Abdurajak Janjalani.

description.zh-cn: 在兄长阿布杜拉加克被击毙后，卡扎菲·简加拉尼成为阿布沙耶夫的领袖。
description.en: After his brother Abdurajak was killed, Khadaffy Janjalani became the leader of Abu Sayyaf.

description.zh-cn: 2007年1月20日，菲律宾军方证实卡扎菲·简加拉尼已经死亡。
description.en: On January 20, 2007, the Philippine military confirmed that Khadaffy Janjalani was dead.

relationships.target: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 苏联入侵阿富汗期间，简加拉尼奔赴阿富汗，加入了所谓的“圣战”行列。
description.en: During the Soviet invasion of Afghanistan, Janjalani went to Afghanistan and joined the so-called 'jihad'.

relationships.target: 阿布杜拉加克·阿布巴卡尔·简加拉尼

description.zh-cn: 阿布杜拉加克·简加拉尼曾在利比亚接受了长达数年的严格军事训练。
description.en: Abdurajak Janjalani received several years of rigorous military training in Libya.

description.zh-cn: 2014年7月23日，阿布沙耶夫宣誓效忠于伊斯兰国，正式名称更改为伊斯兰国东亚省。
description.en: On July 23, 2014, Abu Sayyaf pledged allegiance to the Islamic State, and its official name was changed to Islamic State - East Asia Province.

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫与毛特组织是盟友关系，曾共同发动马拉维危机。
description.en: Abu Sayyaf and the Maute group are allies and jointly launched the Battle of Marawi.

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫以前是基地组织的盟友。
description.en: Abu Sayyaf was formerly an ally of Al-Qaeda.

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫于2000年4月23日在马来西亚西巴丹岛制造了绑架事件。
description.en: Abu Sayyaf carried out the kidnapping incident on Sipadan Island, Malaysia on April 23, 2000.

description.zh-cn: 在2001年5月道斯帕尔马斯绑架事件后，时任总统雅罗育派政府军向阿布沙耶夫的藏身之所发动了大规模的军事进攻。
description.en: After the Dos Palmas kidnapping incident in May 2001, then-President Arroyo sent government troops to launch a large-scale military offensive against Abu Sayyaf's hideout.

description.zh-cn: 2013年11月15日，阿布沙耶夫成员劫持并杀害了台湾游客许立民。
description.en: On November 15, 2013, members of Abu Sayyaf kidnapped and killed Taiwanese tourist Hsu Li-min.

description.zh-cn: 2013年11月15日，阿布沙耶夫成员劫持了台湾游客张安薇，其后获释。
description.en: On November 15, 2013, members of Abu Sayyaf kidnapped Taiwanese tourist Chang An-wei, who was later released.

description.zh-cn: 阿布沙耶夫于2016年9月2日在达沃市一夜市引爆炸弹，制造了爆炸事件。
description.en: Abu Sayyaf detonated a bomb at a night market in Davao City on September 2, 2016, causing the bombing incident.

description.zh-cn: 2017年5月23日，阿布沙耶夫与毛特组织一起占领了马拉维地区，引发了马拉维危机。
description.en: On May 23, 2017, Abu Sayyaf, along with the Maute group, occupied the Marawi region, triggering the Battle of Marawi.

description.zh-cn: 2017年5月23日，毛特组织与阿布沙耶夫一起占领了马拉维地区，引发了马拉维危机。
description.en: On May 23, 2017, the Maute group, along with Abu Sayyaf, occupied the Marawi region, triggering the Battle of Marawi.
